title: Kalhu Archive 2
description: Two eighth-century-B.C. archives were excavated in Fort Shalmaneser, a building complex in the southeastern corner of the city Kalhu. Eleven tablets were found in Room SW 6, a wine store. The archive contains wine lists, as well as notes about the delivery of wine to the palace.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Kalhu on the basis of Pedersén 1987 Plan(s) 66–67.
properties.title: Plan location of Kalhu Archive 2
